doc.previous: In Tibet, the KÄlacakra astrological system is one of the main building blocks in the composition of Tibetan astrological calendars.[5] The astrology in the KÄlacakra is not like the Western system, in that it employs complicated astronomical calculations to determine, for example, the exact location of the planets.
doc.after: According to the KÄlacakra Tantra, Suchandra (Tibetan Dawa Sangpo), dharmaraja of Shambhala, requested that Gautama Buddha teach him how to practice the dharma without renouncing worldly responsibilities.
